`master` (4366b7c)

**Issue description:**
The subscene icon tooltip says "Subscene options", but this icon now opens the subscene in editor.

![godot windows opt tools 64_2017-07-16_16-53-00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5599796/28250799-b47d86ac-6a47-11e7-8c85-cb24ecdbe0cb.png)

data.title: get_executable_path slight change to make it work under OpenBSD
Keyboard QWERTY es_ES bad mapping
data.body:
WIN 7 64 bit GODOT 3.0 build 15/07/2017

**Issue description:**
Typing <>-_[]'¡?¿ ...produce other symbols, I think it can be the default eng layout.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Typing in editor with a QWERTY es_ES keyboard. Numbers and letters are ok, symbols not.

**Link to minimal example project:**
Not necesary, not related with project.

data.title: PoolByteArrayBuilder or ByteStream or similar
data.body:
`PacketPeer` offers a way to send `PoolByteArray` packets with `put_packet`. However this is not currently very useful because it is difficult to work with `PoolByteArray`s.

Part of this is that it is hard to build up a `PoolByteArray` incrementally (like you can with C++ output streams).

There should be something similar to C++ IO streams for building / reading `PoolByteArray`s to make it easier to handle custom data formats, as in network protocols.

data.title: PoolByteArray method for copying data between arrays
data.body:
It should be possible to copy data between `PoolByteArray`s with similar behavior to C `memcpy`, except hopefully with more memory safety (error on failure?).

One thing this would allow is a GDScript implementation of a `PoolByteArray`-builder, by creating an `Array` of `PoolByteArray`s and copying them all into a final `PoolByteArray`.

data.title: methods for converting ints, floats, vectors, etc to / from their byte representations in a PoolByteArray (or RawArray in 2.1)
data.body:
`PacketPeer` offers a way to send `PoolByteArray` packets with `put_packet`. However this is not currently very useful because it is difficult to work with `PoolByteArray`s.

Part of this is because there are no built-in methods for converting primitive types into their byte format. With `int`, you can at least do it inefficiently with arithmetic, but float is more complicated (though still possible) and even less efficient. It should be possible to insert and get values of these types from `PoolByteArray`s, represented in the array with their byte pattern. Something like this in `PoolByteArray`
s methods:
```
int get_int(int start_idx) # Decode the bytes at start_idx as an int
bool set_int(int start_idx, int value) # Insert the byte pattern of value at start_idx, returning false if it ran off the end of the array
```
and similar for other primitive types.

data.title: Expose Dictionary::next to GDNative
data.body:
For iterating over the keys one at a time. In GDNative D bindings, this and godot_dictionary_operator_index allow implementing the loop `foreach(key, ref value; dictionary) { ... }`.

Also fix typo in godot_dictionary_operator_index.

data.title: Control anchoring is incorrect if camera zoom is set
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 8.1, Godot 3.0

**Issue description:**
If camera zoom is other than 1, then root control anchor breaks

**Steps to reproduce:**
Set main camera zoom to 0.5
Make control (fullscreen will be better) with anchor - right | bottom
Change game window size with hands when playing
See that control moves out of window

data.title: Docfix twostep
data.body:
Added documentation for 3.0 for blit_rect_mask.
As Akien suggested in IRC I have two commits, one to sync the old XML template and one to add description for this function

data.title: Label uses mouse filter "ignore" by default, other Controls use "stop"
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 6 x86_64, master 2e73be9

**Issue description:**
Some signals of Control nodes seem not to be emitted as they should, namely (tested so far, might be more broken):
- Control.gui_input
- Control.mouse_entered
- Control.mouse_exited

**Steps to reproduce:**
See attached demo.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[test_signals.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1150392/test_signals.zip)

data.title: Converter 2.1 to 3.0 issues
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
This was tested with version 3: e64b82ebfcc3475c7a7d2a9196bfe20d6c9e3614 version 2: 408f91024c1babc5b60a8fa283a51c44637e00b6

**Issue description:**
_Background:_ Last day I was working on porting plugin from godot 2 to godot 3. So it's a little special case since almost any script was a tool. In normal project conversion works quite well. 
Also I will not enlist problems with variable/function name changes since those are expected to be fixed by the develop on his own.

**The list:**
- [x] Groups are not converted
- [x] Path9Frame nodes are not converted  (class name change to NinePatchRect)
- [ ] ~~Tool scenes are forgetting outgoing signals that were defined in editor~~
- [ ] Control.filter is always `ignore`, this can be misleading, see above and #9657.  Conversion from `focus` would be welcome. 
- [x] Tool Control scenes are losing their size
- [x] Tool Control scenes are losing their position
- [x] Tool Control scenes are losing their anchoring
- [ ] Tool scenes are sometimes re not linked to their scripts (not very often, haven't isolated)
- [ ] Old .fnt are not recognized #9610
- [ ] Converter is unable to convert some models imported from dae file #9715

Some properties for animation are not converted (sorry don't have a list at the time, but for me it was most of Control ones (inside rect)), not sure what is status of others?
- [ ] (not 100% sure) all inside Control.rect 
- [ ] (not 100% sure) all inside CanvasItem.visibility
- [ ] Control: rect/pos -> rect_position
- [ ] Control: rect/scale -> rect_scale
- [ ] Control: rect/size -> rect_size



Some signals were renamed, so they are not connected/converted:
- [x] Node.enter_tree - > tree_entered
- [x] Node.exit_tree - > tree_exited
- [x] Control.focus_enter -> focus_entered
- [x] Control.focus_exit -> focus_exited
- [x] Control.input_event -> gui_input
- [x] Control.modal_close -> modal_closed
- [x] Control.mouse_enter -> mouse_entered
- [x] Control.mouse_exit -> mouse_exited
- [x] Control.mouse_exit -> mouse_exited
- [x] Control.mouse_exit -> mouse_exited

Those lists are probably very much incomplete, but I will try to update them when I see something new, also some of those are really easy to fix.  Also I'm not saying all of those NEED to be fixed, but some of them should be for sure, and even if something wont be fixed it's better to be aware since it might be helpful during migration guide doc creation.

If you will want to share your own observations always test on the newest 2.0 build. And paste build git hash so we could know what version it was. 

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project:**
Not very convenient, but if you really want to start with something here is a project in which I was trying to reproduce my issues: [Test2 to 3 conversion.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1150283/Test2.to.3.conversion.zip)

data.title: Fix editor crash while exiting debuggger
Ctrl+left mouse click on filepath should open a resource
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 17.04, 0ee47fefbe4f746d6e00e863e4523398365b4e47

**Issue description:**
When holding control and hovering mouse cursor above filepath, it seems like it's possible to click. But clicking don't do anything. From console output it seems functionality is coded already but editor is getting only small part of the filepath: 
![filepath_click](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6129594/28238452-c8077d62-6953-11e7-9448-5f694a53ea7e.gif)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open script editor.
2. Write full path to some scene (beginning with res://)
3. ctrl + left mouse button click on the path.

#119 0x00000000017a861a in Object::notification (this=0x366f7d0, p_notification=1, p_reversed=true) at core/object.cpp:863
---Type <return> to continue, or q <return> to quit---
#120 0x00000000017a609f in Object::_predelete (this=0x366f7d0) at core/object.cpp:259
#121 0x00000000017b0648 in predelete_handler (p_object=0x366f7d0) at core/object.cpp:1781
#122 0x0000000000df847e in memdelete<Viewport> (p_class=0x366f7d0) at core/os/memory.h:277
#123 0x0000000000defa78 in SceneTree::finish (this=0x3672010) at scene/main/scene_main_loop.cpp:546

#125 0x000000000040b07f in main (argc=2, argv=0x7fffffffda48) at platform/x11/godot_x11.cpp:49
```

Likely a bug introduced by #8979, ping @Geequlim.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Start the Godot editor
- Close it

data.title: Build errors with Bullet physics engine Static Library - Unresolved external symbol
data.body:
Windows 64bit - Godot version: 3.0 alpha

I've implemented Bullet physics engine, but now that I've registered the BulletPhysicsServer class using the register_Bullet_types class:

```
void register_Bullet_types() {
    ClassDB::register_class<BulletPhysicsServer>();
}
```

I get a building error, that is caused (I think) to the bad configuration of SCsub file. The error is: `error LNK2019: unresolved external symbol when I build the code`.

The file system structure is that:

```
godot
├── modules
│   └── Bullet
│       └── SCsub
│       └── some_file.h
│       └── some_file.cpp
└── thirdparty
    └── Bullet
        ├── include
        │     └── ALL_HEADERS.h
        └── Win64
              └── lib
                   └── ALL_LIBRARIES.lib
```

The SCsub file is that:

```
#!/usr/bin/env python

Import('env')

thirdparty_dir = "#thirdparty/Bullet/"
thirdparty_lib = thirdparty_dir + "Win64/lib/"

env_Bullet = env.Clone()

thirdparty_sources = [
        "Bullet2FileLoader",
        "Bullet3Collision",
        "Bullet3Common",
        "Bullet3Dynamics",
        "Bullet3Geometry",
        "Bullet3OpenCL_clew",
        "BulletCollision",
        "BulletDynamics",
        "BulletInverseDynamics",
        "BulletSoftBody",
        "LinearMath"
    ]
thirdparty_sources = [thirdparty_lib + file + ".lib" for file in thirdparty_sources]
env_Bullet.StaticLibrary(target = 'Bullet', source = thirdparty_sources )

env_Bullet.Append(CPPPATH=[thirdparty_dir + "/include/"])
env_Bullet.add_source_files(env.modules_sources, "*.cpp")
```

Here there is the Building error:

```
[...]
modules.windows.tools.64.lib(GodotCollisionDispatcher.windows.tools.64.obj) : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol "public: virtual class btCollisionAlgorithm * __cdecl btCollisionDispatcher::findAlgorithm(struct btCollisionObjectWrapper const *,struct btCollisionObjectWrapper const *,class btPersistentManifold *,enum ebtDispatcherQueryType)" (?findAlgorithm@btCollisionDispatcher@@UEAAPEAVbtCollisionAlgorithm@@PEBUbtCollisionObjectWrapper@@0PEAVbtPersistentManifold@@W4ebtDispatcherQueryType@@@Z)
modules.windows.tools.64.lib(GodotCollisionDispatcher.windows.tools.64.obj) : error LNK2019: unresolved external symbol "public: virtual bool __cdecl btCollisionDispatcher::needsCollision(class btCollisionObject const *,class btCollisionObject const *)" (?needsCollision@btCollisionDispatcher@@UEAA_NPEBVbtCollisionObject@@0@Z) referenced in function "public: virtual bool __cdecl GodotCollisionDispatcher::needsCollision(class btCollisionObject const *,class btCollisionObject const *)" (?needsCollision@GodotCollisionDispatcher@@UEAA_NPEBVbtCollisionObject@@0@Z)
modules.windows.tools.64.lib(GodotCollisionDispatcher.windows.tools.64.obj) : error LNK2019: unresolved external symbol "public: virtual bool __cdecl btCollisionDispatcher::needsResponse(class btCollisionObject const *,class btCollisionObject const *)" (?needsResponse@btCollisionDispatcher@@UEAA_NPEBVbtCollisionObject@@0@Z) referenced in function "public: virtual bool __cdecl GodotCollisionDispatcher::needsResponse(class btCollisionObject const *,class btCollisionObject const *)" (?needsResponse@GodotCollisionDispatcher@@UEAA_NPEBVbtCollisionObject@@0@Z)
modules.windows.tools.64.lib(GodotCollisionDispatcher.windows.tools.64.obj) : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol "public: virtual void __cdecl btCollisionDispatcher::dispatchAllCollisionPairs(class btOverlappingPairCache *,struct btDispatcherInfo const &,class btDispatcher *)" (?dispatchAllCollisionPairs@btCollisionDispatcher@@UEAAXPEAVbtOverlappingPairCache@@AEBUbtDispatcherInfo@@PEAVbtDispatcher@@@Z)
modules.windows.tools.64.lib(GodotCollisionDispatcher.windows.tools.64.obj) : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol "public: virtual void * __cdecl btCollisionDispatcher::allocateCollisionAlgorithm(int)" (?allocateCollisionAlgorithm@btCollisionDispatcher@@UEAAPEAXH@Z)
modules.windows.tools.64.lib(GodotCollisionDispatcher.windows.tools.64.obj) : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol "public: virtual void __cdecl btCollisionDispatcher::freeCollisionAlgorithm(void *)" (?freeCollisionAlgorithm@btCollisionDispatcher@@UEAAXPEAX@Z)
bin\godot.windows.tools.64.exe : fatal error LNK1120: 70 unresolved externals
scons: *** [bin\godot.windows.tools.64.exe] Error 1120
scons: building terminated because of errors.
00:18:33: The process "C:\Python27\scons.bat" exited with code 2.
Error while building/deploying project godot (kit: Desktop)
The kit Desktop has configuration issues which might be the root cause for this problem.
When executing step "Custom Process Step"
00:18:33: Elapsed time: 00:37.
```

So what is the right way of include a static Library using scons in order to avoid error LNK2019: unresolved external symbol this error?

data.title: VisualScript: Godot 3.0, no literal values
data.body: There should be a way to create a literal primitive in VisualScript. So far as I can tell, this is currently impossible. You first have to create a member or local variable and then you can create a Variable / LocalVarGet node that retrieves it via name. However, it would be nice if I could just make a Literal node, set the type to String (or have respective StringLiteral, IntLiteral, etc. nodes), and then set the value to "Hello, World", or even an entire paragraph of content (in a TextEdit).

data.title: Changed badge to use HTTPS
data.body:
Really minor change, I just changed the Code Triage badge to use https instead of http since https is available.

Thanks for your time! ^ _ ^

data.title: Build errors with Bullet physics engine Static Library
data.body:
Windows 64bit - Godot version: 3.0 alpha

I've implemented Bullet physics engine, but now that I've registered the BulletPhysicsServer class using the register_Bullet_types class:

```
void register_Bullet_types() {
    ClassDB::register_class<BulletPhysicsServer>();
}
```
I get a building error, that is caused (I think) to the bad configuration of SCsub file.

The file system structure is that:
```
godot
├── modules
│   └── Bullet
│       └── SCsub
│       └── some_file.h
│       └── some_file.cpp
└── thirdparty
    └── Bullet
        ├── include
        │     └── ALL_HEADERS.h
        └── Win64
              └── lib
                   └── ALL_LIBRARIES.lib
```

The SCsub file is that:
```
#!/usr/bin/env python

Import('env')

thirdparty_dir = "#thirdparty/Bullet/"
thirdparty_lib = thirdparty_dir + "Win64/"

env_Bullet = env.Clone()

thirdparty_sources = [
        "lib/Bullet2FileLoader.lib",
        "lib/Bullet3Collision.lib",
        "lib/Bullet3Common.lib",
        "lib/Bullet3Dynamics.lib",
        "lib/Bullet3Geometry.lib",
        "lib/Bullet3OpenCL_clew.lib",
        "lib/BulletCollision.lib",
        "lib/BulletDynamics.lib",
        "lib/BulletInverseDynamics.lib",
        "lib/BulletSoftBody.lib",
        "lib/LinearMath.lib"
    ]
thirdparty_sources = [thirdparty_lib + file for file in thirdparty_sources]
env_Bullet.StaticLibrary(target = 'Bullet', source = thirdparty_sources )

env_Bullet.Append(CPPPATH=[thirdparty_dir + "/include/"])

env_Bullet.add_source_files(env.modules_sources, "*.cpp")
```

Here there is the Building error:
```
[...]
Generic6DOFJointBullet.cpp
GodotCollisionDispatcher.cpp
D:\WorkSpace\GitHubProjects\godot\thirdparty\Bullet\include\bullet/BulletDynamics/ConstraintSolver/btSolverConstraint.h(20): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'LinearMath/btVector3.h': No such file or directory
d:\workspace\githubprojects\godot\thirdparty\bullet\include\bullet\bulletcollision\collisiondispatch\btCollisionObject.h(19): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'LinearMath/btTransform.h': No such file or directory
D:\WorkSpace\GitHubProjects\godot\thirdparty\Bullet\include\bullet/BulletDynamics/ConstraintSolver/btSolverConstraint.h(20): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'LinearMath/btVector3.h': No such file or directory
scons: *** [modules\Bullet\ConeTwistJointBullet.windows.tools.64.obj] Error 2
scons: *** [modules\Bullet\AreaBullet.windows.tools.64.obj] Error 2
scons: *** [modules\Bullet\Generic6DOFJointBullet.windows.tools.64.obj] Error 2
D:\WorkSpace\GitHubProjects\godot\thirdparty\Bullet\include\bullet/BulletDynamics/ConstraintSolver/btSolverConstraint.h(20): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'LinearMath/btVector3.h': No such file or directory
scons: *** [modules\Bullet\BodyBullet.windows.tools.64.obj] Error 2
D:\WorkSpace\GitHubProjects\godot\thirdparty\Bullet\include\bullet/BulletDynamics/ConstraintSolver/btSolverConstraint.h(20): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'LinearMath/btVector3.h': No such file or directory
scons: *** [modules\Bullet\BulletPhysicsServer.windows.tools.64.obj] Error 2
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\INCLUDE\exception(359): warning C4577: 'noexcept' used with no exception handling mode specified; termination on exception is not guaranteed. Specify /EHsc
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\INCLUDE\exception(359): warning C4577: 'noexcept' used with no exception handling mode specified; termination on exception is not guaranteed. Specify /EHsc
scons: building terminated because of errors.
19:08:16: The process "C:\Python27\scons.bat" exited with code 2.
Error while building/deploying project godot (kit: Desktop)
The kit Desktop has configuration issues which might be the root cause for this problem.
When executing step "Custom Process Step"
19:08:16: Elapsed time: 00:06.
```
As you can see I'm including the Bullets generated headers as a normal cpp files: env_Bullet.Append(CPPPATH=[thirdparty_dir + "/include/"]).

The build process fail due to this problem because the path inside the Bullets headers is not correct, since (for godot) the correct is **bullet/LinearMath/btVector3.h** and not **LinearMath/btVector3.h**.

So what is the right way of include a static Library using scons?

data.title: ES3 (no glad): Intel Mesa shader errors (CUSTOM BUILD)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

godot 3 (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/e70d36071e1e11faa57d3ed072895dd90dc53dcf) on debian stretch. **CUSTOM BUILD**

```
GL_VERSION: OpenGL ES 3.0 Mesa 13.0.6
GL_RENDERER: Mesa DRI Intel(R) Sandybridge Desktop 
```

**Issue description:**

The standard build (using glad) works for me with just the known SSAO Intel issue.

This is about a problem that users won't see, since I'm using a custom build that links against OpenGL ES instead of OpenGL and doesn't use the "glad" layer. I report it just in case you think similar problems might happen with other ES drivers too. From the log fragments below you should be able to see if this is a problem you want to fix or if this is just the Intel Mesa ES driver being too picky.

**Steps to reproduce:**

First build a custom version of godot ( https://github.com/efornara/frt/commit/d982e51335df7e2d2b7240e09abc43f135c6aca5):

```
sudo apt-get install libsdl2-dev
( cd platform ;  git clone https://github.com/efornara/frt )
scons platform=frt target=release builtin_openssl=yes
```

Then run the new executable from the material demo directory.

**Link to minimal example project:**

Standard material example.

**Log fragments:**

```

hdr supported: 0
GLES3: max ubo light: 409
GLES3: max ubo reflections: 455, ubo size: 144

173: 		atan(normal.x, normal.z),

175: 	);

178: 		st.x += M_PI*2.0;
179: 
180: 	st/=vec2(M_PI*2.0,M_PI);
181: 
182: 	return textureLod(pano,st,0.0);
183:

185:

194: 	norm.xy/=1.0+abs(norm.z);

199: 	return textureLod(source_dual_paraboloid_array, vec3(norm.xy, float(source_array_index) ), 0.0);
200: 
201: }

ERROR: _display_error_with_code: CubemapFilterShaderGLES3: Fragment Program Compilation Failed:
0:16(1): error: No precision specified in this scope for type `sampler2DArray'
0:196(6): error: could not implicitly convert operands to relational operator
0:196(6): error: if-statement condition must be scalar boolean

1: #version 300 es
2: #define MAX_LIGHT_DATA_STRUCTS 409
3: #define MAX_FORWARD_LIGHTS 8
4: #define MAX_REFLECTION_DATA_STRUCTS 455

data.title: Threaded HTTPClient request blocks the main thread
Dropdown menu to select method
data.body:
Hello there, so I was tweaking the engine to see if I could help improve it, and since I was struggling when I had to connect signals to methods, and I found some cool usages for that, I was thinking about improving the connection menu. My ideas were:

1. Add a dropdown menu to select a list of all the currently available methods of the node
1. When selecting an already existing method automatically add the needed arguments
1. Be able to edit an already connected signal

Seems like someone tried this before but for some reason he/she commented the code as we can see in [connections_dialog.cpp](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/editor/connections_dialog.cpp#L116-L143)

I can try to implement it myself and make a pull request, but I'll need some guidance on that  :>

Then I designed this just for concept
![new_connection_concept](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10171059/28215710-4b3202a4-6885-11e7-9e84-30bb0719faea.png)

data.title: Add script editor shortcut to delete current line
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 3 - Any platform
May also be applied to godot 2.1.4 while still in beta (i hope)

**Issue description:**
Must code editors have shortcut to delete the current where the cursor is and moving all lines below that line up.
By default:
Notepad++: ctrl-l
Visual Studio: ctrl-l
Eclipse: ctrl-d
VS Code: ctrl-shift-k
Atom: ctrl-shift-k
Vanilla notepad: none (can be emulated with Home, Shift-End, Del)

**Steps to reproduce:**
In the editor settings, in the shortcuts tab there is no option to bind a key to delete the current line.
Note that ctrl-x may look as a possible solution, but you loose the clipboard content that way.

**Suggestion:**
Because by default ctrl-l is go-to-line, you can use ctrl-d or just leave it blank so the users can choose one.

data.title: Fix uncheckable checkboxes in RMB menu. closes #9625
data.body:
When node has a script (or any other resource), then all items in RMB menu will change their position since "Sub resource" section will appear at the top. 
Setting checkboxes for `Editable children` and `Load as placeholder` were hard-coded for concrete items ids and that was the reason of the issue. 
This pr will fix this for "Editable children" and "Load as placeholder" options, by adding new method to `PopupMenu` that can return `idx` of an item basing on it's text.

Manjaro XFCE Edition - Godot 3.0 alpha (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/9a502d3c17d4701b0fd8390e515c52a69dc0bf85)

Open help->Classes->Viewport.
Press first few method names like clear(), find_world().

data.title: Adds init callbacks to SceneTree
data.body:
I need this for doing some initializations after the SceneTree is initialized.
It's a clone of the idle callback. Is there a reason not to use Vector for this?

data.title: Moved binds of PRIMITIVE_* contants from ArrayMesh to Mesh
data.body: First contribution so please let me know if it is not up to contribution guidelines. Fixes #9182.
